page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: The area is a bit of a wilderness as far as transport is concerned, a bus is a rare site, only 2 a day to Buck. On Saturdays, Paynes run a bus from Buck. to Northampton. Nearest railway station is Bletchley getting to London Euston in 1 hour. Old folk often use a taxi to visit doctor or dentist. The roads are not safe for cyclists, the A413 which cuts through this area is very winding, with nasty zig-zag bends by the Bull & Butcher' in Akeley. By the age of 17 young people are learning to drive, but before that get motorised cycles - what sort of social life can they have without wheels?
